dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A listener writes in, 'Just heard about the Trump kids buying up all this real estate while their dad was in office... it's wild that they spent $10 million on his own properties through over a thousand transactions.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A listener writes in, 'Just heard about the Trump kids buying up all this real estate while their dad was in office... it's wild that they spent ten dollars million on his own properties through over a thousand transactions.'
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since their fathers inauguration, they have sold off $110 million of the presidents real estate holdingsthrough more than 100 tiny transactions that have mostly flown under the radar.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and you know, a lot of those deals just flew under the radar, which is, uh, pretty remarkable when you think about it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and you know, a lot of those deals just flew under the radar, which is, uh, pretty remarkable when you think about it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since their fathers inauguration, they have sold off $110 million of the presidents real estate holdingsthrough more than 100 tiny transactions that have mostly flown under the radar.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Barron Trump, he had this statement back in February about accelerating their growth for the time being—like, they were really leaning into the casino plans.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Barron Trump, he had this statement back in February about accelerating their growth for the time being-like, they were really leaning into the casino plans.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If we have to slow down our growth for the time being, we are happy to do it, Eric Trump said in a statement when they scrapped the hotel plans in February.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and Don Jr. mentioned that when politics are in full swing, they'll go back to building what he called the most basic and inexpensive properties. Which is... quite a claim.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and Don Jr. mentioned that when politics are in full swing, they'll go back to building what he called the most basic and inexpensive properties. Which is... quite a claim.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Added Don Jr.: When politics are over, we will resume doing what we do best, which is building the best and most luxurious properties in the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But honestly, their strategy seems to be working—I mean, the president's net worth went up a billion dollars since he took office.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But honestly, their strategy seems to be working-I mean, the president's net worth went up a billion dollars since he took office.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The president is worth $3.1 billion (good for No. 275 on The Forbes 400), the same as a year ago and down $400 million from when he took office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, to $5.1 billion. And the kids are playing it ambitiously, like acquiring all that debt and funneling cash.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, to five point one dollars billion. And the kids are playing it ambitiously, like acquiring all that debt and funneling cash.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Instead, the Trump children have been chipping away at the debt that helped build their fathers empire, quietly paying down an estimated $60 million since the inauguration.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: They even bought land in the Dominican Republic for $32 million in early 2020, which kinda validated their dad's pledge to pursue foreign deals while in office.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They even bought land in the Dominican Republic for thirty two dollars million in early twenty twenty, which kinda validated their dad's pledge to pursue foreign deals while in office.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the Dominican Republic, the younger Trumps sold a piece of land in January 2018 for $3.2 million. It was the clearest violation of their fathers pledge to do no new foreign deals while in office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And some of these deals, like the sale of Spring Creek Towers, required Mike Pence's approval as Secretary of Defense? That's just... unusual.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And some of these deals, like the sale of Spring Creek Towers, required Mike Pence's approval as Secretary of Defense? That's just... unusual.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Secretary of Housing & Urban Development Ben Carson had to give his approval to make the deal happen, according to property records.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. Plus, they'reinvesting heavily—updating Trump Tower, that Las Vegas office building, even buying a shack next to Mar-a-Lago from Ivanka's son for $1.5 million.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. Plus, they'reinvesting heavily-updating Trump Tower, that Las Vegas office building, even buying a shack next to Mar-a-Lago from Ivanka's son for one point five dollars million.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But theyve really made only one new purchase, buying an $18.5 million mansion next to Mar-a-Lagofrom their aunt, Maryanne Trump Barry.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's like they're doubling down on the assets that built the empire in the first place. Since the inauguration, they've acquired an estimated $600 million in new stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's like they're doubling down on the assets that built the empire in the first place. Since the inauguration, they've acquired an estimated six hundred dollars million in new stuff.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Instead, the Trump children have been chipping away at the debt that helped build their fathers empire, quietly paying down an estimated $60 million since the inauguration.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And in New York alone, they added around $190 million in liabilities at places like 40 Wall Street.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And in New York alone, they added around one hundred ninety dollars million in liabilities at places like forty Wall Street.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In New York, they wiped out roughly $19 million of liabilities at 40 Wall Street, 6 East 57th Street and 502 Park Avenue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: You gotta wonder how much of this is just, uh, good business versus leveraging the political position.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You gotta wonder how much of this is just, uh, good business versus leveraging the political position.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Either way, it's a fascinating—and risky—bet on the future of the Trump brand.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Either way, it's a fascinating-and risky-bet on the future of the Trump brand.

artist_script:
HostA: A listener writes in, 'Just heard about the Trump kids buying up all this real estate while their dad was in office... it's wild that they spent $10 million on his own properties through over a thousand transactions.'
HostB: Yeah, and you know, a lot of those deals just flew under the radar, which is, uh, pretty remarkable when you think about it.
HostA: And Barron Trump, he had this statement back in February about accelerating their growth for the time being—like, they were really leaning into the casino plans.
HostB: Right, and Don Jr. mentioned that when politics are in full swing, they’ll go back to building what he called the most basic and inexpensive properties. Which is... quite a claim.
HostA: But honestly, their strategy seems to be working—I mean, the president’s net worth went up a billion dollars since he took office.
HostB: Yeah, to $5.1 billion. And the kids are playing it ambitiously, like acquiring all that debt and funneling cash.
HostA: They even bought land in the Dominican Republic for $32 million in early 2020, which kinda validated their dad’s pledge to pursue foreign deals while in office.
HostB: And some of these deals, like the sale of Spring Creek Towers, required Mike Pence’s approval as Secretary of Defense? That’s just... unusual.
HostA: Totally. Plus, they’reinvesting heavily—updating Trump Tower, that Las Vegas office building, even buying a shack next to Mar-a-Lago from Ivanka’s son for $1.5 million.
HostB: It’s like they’re doubling down on the assets that built the empire in the first place. Since the inauguration, they’ve acquired an estimated $600 million in new stuff.
HostA: And in New York alone, they added around $190 million in liabilities at places like 40 Wall Street.
HostB: You gotta wonder how much of this is just, uh, good business versus leveraging the political position.
HostA: Either way, it’s a fascinating—and risky—bet on the future of the Trump brand.
